perturbation.original_text: MBE agrees to use its commercially reasonable efforts to execute agreements, or to facilitate the execution of agreements among the appropriate parties, so that such Basic Fee is paid to the Company directly from the carrier which ships such package no later than fifteen (15) days following the end of the month in which such package was shipped.
perturbation.changed_text: MBE agrees to use its commercially reasonable efforts to execute agreements, or to facilitate the execution of agreements among the appropriate parties, so that such Basic Fee is paid to the Company directly from the carrier which ships such package no later than sixty (60) days following the end of the month in which such package was shipped.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies payment within 15 days, which is a reasonable timeframe. The modified text extends this period to 60 days. This could create issues under California law, which favors prompt payment and could view extended payment terms as an unreasonable delay, potentially violating implied covenants of good faith and fair dealing. California Prompt Payment Law is violated.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Prompt Payment Law, Implied Covenant of Good Faith and Fair Dealing.

perturbation.original_text: The Company shall pay such amounts, less the relevant Bounty Fee or eBay Fee then in effect, to MBE on the next business day or as soon as reasonably practicable (but in any event within one week) following the shipment date of each package, and MBE agrees to distribute such amounts to the MBE Centers.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company shall pay such amounts, less the relevant Bounty Fee or eBay Fee then in effect, to MBE at the Company's discretion, and MBE agrees to distribute such amounts to the MBE Centers at their convenience.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates payment 'on the next business day or as soon as reasonably practicable (but in any event within one week)'. The modified text removes this defined timeframe, stating payment will be made 'at the Company's discretion' and MBE will distribute payments 'at their convenience.' This is a contradiction since it creates uncertainty and potential for unreasonable delays in payment, potentially violating California labor laws and implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Labor Laws related to prompt payment, Implied Covenant of Good Faith and Fair Dealing.

perturbation.original_text: MBE shall, at any time during the term of this Agreement, be entitled to audit all such records upon ten (10) days written notice to the Company, in order to confirm the accuracy of such records and conformance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement; provided, however, that no more than one (1) such audit may be conducted in any ninety (90)-day period.
perturbation.changed_text: MBE shall be entitled to audit all such records at the Company's discretion, in order to confirm the accuracy of such records. However, such audit should only be conducted when the company approved the requirement, and under company guidelines.
perturbation.explanation: The original text allows MBE to audit records with 10 days' notice, but limits it to once every 90 days. The modified text makes audits subject to the company's discretion and company guidelines, completely removing MBE's right to audit. This modification eliminates a right to audit and sets audit at company's discretion, violating principles of good faith and fair dealing.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Covenant of Good Faith and Fair Dealing, Contract Law principles related to audit rights.
